intro: Jacobinia purpusii, commonly known as the silverleaf jacobinia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy flowers. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery-white pubescence, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are borne in clusters, adding ornamental value to the plant. Jacobinia purpusii is often cultivated as a decorative shrub in gardens due to its attractive foliage and fragrance.
